intro: Mikania chaetoloba, commonly known as the silky mikania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its slender, climbing stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Mikania chaetoloba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
